conclusion: The conductor is at rest, so the downward gravitational force must be balanced by an upward magnetic force on the rod.
The only emf in the closed circuit is the battery of emf E and internal resistance r.
The total resistance in the loop is (R + r).
The steady current is therefore I = E / (R + r).

For the magnetic force on the horizontal rod PQ to act upward (opposite to weight), the current through the rod must flow from the right rail (Q) toward the left rail (P). The battery is oriented accordingly.
The magnitude of the magnetic force on the rod is F = I L B.
The direction of the magnetic force is upward (chosen by the current orientation just stated).
Force balance for equilibrium gives mg = I L B.
Solve for B: B = mg / (I L) = mg / [(E/(R + r)) L] = mg (R + r) / (E L).
Final result: Magnetic-induction intensity B = mg (R + r) / (E L).
